Game1

Class Game1

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • Game1.Game1
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Game1
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    Game1 has a player-controlled boat and trash moving across the screen. The goal is to move the boat by clicking where you want to go, and collecting the trash before it reaches the beach.
    Version:
    5/17
    Author:
    Team 7

    • Method Detail

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        When mouse is pressed, assigns mousedown to true, acquires the mouse position on screen and check if the exit button was pressed.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        When mouse button is released, sets mousedown to false
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter

      • updatePlayer

        void updatePlayer()
        Updates player object by calling it's move() method

      • updateTrash

        void updateTrash(int index)
        Updates trash object by pulling it from the ArrayList of gameObjects and making sure it is a trash object. If it is active, calls it's move method and updates score and maxtrash/trashcount accordingly if the object was caught by the player.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of Trash object in arrayList of gameObjects

      • updateLives

        void updateLives(int i)
        Updates player lives by pulling trash object from the ArrayList at given index and checks to see if the object made it to the beach, decrementing Lives and trashcount if so, and resetting the game if Lives is 0 or less.
        Parameters:
        i - Index of trash object in ArrayList of gameObjects

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Skips every other tick. If an 'on' tick, adds to counter and adds new trash if certain amount of ticks have gone by. Updates player, trash, and score objects.

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<gameObject> getObjects()
        Returns ArrayList of gameObjects in Game1
        Returns:
        Returns ArrayList of gameObjects

      • resetGame

        private void resetGame()
        Resets Game1 by setting game values back to starting values, clearing the ArrayList, and setting gameState back to Menu.

      • mouseOver

        boolean mouseOver(int mx,
                  int my,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Checks to see if the mouse is over given coordinates on the screen.
        Parameters:
        mx - Mouse x-position
        my - Mouse y-position
        x - x-position of image being checked against mouse x-position
        y - y-position of image being checked against mouse y-position
        width - Width of image being checked for mouse over
        height - Height of image being checked for mouse over
        Returns:
        Returns true if mouse is over given image position, false if otherwise
